mobs.keywords: translucent female woman spectral form spectral-woman
mobs.long_desc: A translucent female form, draped in flowing robes, floats here.
mobs.desc: This spectral female gives off an eerie bluish glow as she floats a few inches off the ground. Dressed in what was once, centuries ago, a wedding gown worn by a bride on her wedding day; an air of sadness and despair surrounds her. She seems to be intently looking for something.

mobs.long_desc: The spectral form of a man floats here dressed in finely tailored robes. He seems to have something clutched in his hands.
mobs.desc: An eerie bluish light emanates from this ghost-like figure. Dressed in what was once, centuries ago, a wedding outfit he clutches a toy figure of a bride in his hands. The figure must have come from the wedding cake. A deep air of sadness surrounds him and a tear runs, eternally, down his check as he gazes at the little figure of the bride.

mobs.long_desc: A spectral guard floats above his corpse here.
mobs.desc: Outlined by a hazy blue light, this transparent spectral form is dressed in an ancient form of armor that has been unseen for centuries. Apparently unaware that he died long ago, he continues to diligently perform his duties as a guard.

mobs.long_desc: The form of a hideous woman is floating here. The Banshee is surrounded by an eerie grey light!
mobs.desc: Only a great act of treachery or evil can warp a soul into the hideous monstrosity before you. Disheveled and dressed in tattered cloth this spectral form is destined to wander the earth forever for her 'crimes' A look of pain and horror has been stamped on her face.

mobs.long_desc: A shimmering light seems to be moving through the water.
mobs.desc: The water forms into a long cylindrical shape which vaguely resembles a serpent. A blue light seems to emanate from within it.

mobs.long_desc: Huge red eyes peer out of the darkness.. Five huge red eyes!
mobs.desc: This huge spider is easily the size of a man, with a bloated body and tiny little head surmounted with red eyes. It has large mandibles which it clicks together frequently, and its legs are delicate and slender.

mobs.keywords: lizard-man lesser lizard man reptilian humanoid
mobs.long_desc: Crouched in the swamp, a reptilian humanoid watches you with glowing eyes.
mobs.desc: Humanoid in shape, this green-scaled creature looks like a lizard that has stood up on its hind legs. Strong and sinister-looking, it flicks out a forked tongue to taste the air frequently. It lopes along easily on its almost-human legs.

mobs.keywords: lizard-man elite lizard man guard lizard-elite-one reptilian elite-lizard-man
mobs.long_desc: A reptilian watches you carefully, breathing an air of confidence.
mobs.desc: This reptilian stands a proud seven feet tall. His scales are lighter than his smaller cousins and his posture more erect. Scars and missing scales on his body inform you he is a battle-hardened veteran.

mobs.long_desc: A reptilian in fine grey robes stares down at you.
mobs.desc: Humanoid in shape, this creature resembles a lizard in almost every way possible, from his green scaled body to his small lizardlike head, with its forked tongue and slit-pupilled eyes. It is taller than a human man, and looks very commanding indeed.

mobs.long_desc: A huge reptilian humanoid towers above you. An air of power and nobility surrounds him.
mobs.desc: Over nine feet tall this huge reptilian is dressed in rich silk robes. A huge tail snakes out behind him. His scales, a lighter shade of green that the other lizard men, have blue highlights. A forked tongue flickers in and out of his mouth as he gazes down on you. Immense power radiates from him!

mobs.long_desc: A hideous creature looks down on you with utter contempt.
mobs.desc: Covered in blood red scales, this huge creature could only have come from some unknown plane of pure evil.  Huge curved horns seem to sprout from his head, while huge bat-shaped wings are tucked tightly on his back.  A sense of pure evil emanates from him.  The look in his eyes is one of pure hatred.

mobs.long_desc: A crazed old woman in tattered robes stares at you.
mobs.desc: The woman before you is an utter mess. Her hair is stringy and unkempt. Her clothes tattered and reeking with some foul stench. She seems to babble incoherently and drool continually pours from her mouth.

mobs.long_desc: A statue of a horrified older man stands here.
mobs.desc: Apparently crafted by an expert the look on the statues face has an air of reality you have never seen on a statue before. You can only guess that the artists intention was to display a moment of horror on this poor fellow's face as he was out hunting.

mobs.long_desc: A statue of a young woman in pain and fear stands here.
mobs.desc: Dressed in what appears to be a flowing nightgown this woman appears to be in some sort of eternal pain. Her mouth is opened as if screaming, her body arched as if in pain. However, no sounds come from her mouth, only silence.

mobs.long_desc: A statue of a defiant older woman stands here.
mobs.desc: The statue of this woman seems to be standing up to some aggressor that only she can see. You can almost picture her children clutching her skirt as she stands up bravely to someone who threatens their safety.

mobs.long_desc: A massive iron humanoid stands here, guarding the room and its contents.
mobs.desc: This massive humanoid, standing well over fifteen feet in height, is made of pure iron. His huge muscles seem all the more intimidating because they are made of metal. His eyes glow with a soft green light, and they seem to be following your movements. It might not be a good idea to touch anything in this room.

mobs.long_desc: An eerie transparent young woman lies on the bed.
mobs.desc: Dressed in what was once considered a wedding gown, centuries ago, this strange form glows with an eerie blue light. Slightly transparent she seems oblivious to your presence, pre-occupied with her sorrow. She is extremely beautiful and a feeling of sadness passes over you as you realize that she must have been struck down on her wedding day.

mobs.long_desc: The black ceiling is moving.
mobs.desc: This strange creature vaguely resembles a giant manta ray. It has flat rubbery appearance to it. It has the ability to move about quite quickly and can float through the air. However its favored mode of attack is blend into the ceiling and wait for an unsuspecting victim to walk underneath.

mobs.long_desc: Thick roots snake from the wall and rest their tips in the pool.
mobs.desc: The roots come out of the wall at various places around the wall, but concentrated generally to the west. They look like huge, flexible wooden tree trunks about two feet in diameter and over ten feet long.

mobs.long_desc: A large reptilian dressed in hardened leather armor watches you carefully.
mobs.desc: This reptilian is slightly taller than the others and seems to be a leader of sorts judging from the way the others react to him. He is dressed in hardened leather armor and wears a flowing cape on his back. His scales have a tint of yellow in them and he bears many signs of combat. He is most likely a veteran of many fights.

mobs.long_desc: A black shadow seems to cling to the darkness.
mobs.desc: He betrayed his king for the love of a woman thereby damning them both to lives of eternal torment. This black shadowy creature seems unsure of his surroundings. Every few moments he screams a deathly wail of pain, torture, and sadness.

mobs.keywords: reptilian elite lizard man elite-lizard-man lizard-elite second-elite
mobs.long_desc: A reptilian watches you carefully, breathing an air of confidence.
mobs.desc: This reptilian stands a proud seven feet tall.  His scales are lighter than his smaller cousins and his posture more erect.  Scars and missing scales on his body inform you he is a battle-hardened veteran.

mobs.long_desc: A female reptilian is here muttering a strange mantra.
mobs.desc: Slightly smaller and more frail then the male lizard guards, this female does not make eye contact with you.  Her scales are extremely ligh, almost a pale green color.  There seems to be more intelligence about her, at least more so then your average reptilian creature.

objects.ground: A long sword engulfed in &6blue flame&0 lies here.

extras.text: This mighty sword was the prized possession of the Lizard King, ruler of the Great Northern Swamp.  Forged from mythril and enchanted in the depths of the castle beneath the swamp, the sword was created to bring fire to the darkest of places and burn all enemies before it.  It is truly a staggering weapon to behold!

objects.ground: A breastplate of gleaming white metal lies here.
A small doll of a bride lies forgotten in the dust.
A breastplate of gleaming white metal lies here.
A small key made of pure crystal lies in the dust.
A key with its head shaped like a lion lies in the dust.
A large key made of bronze lies here.
An old iron key lies covered in ages of rust.
A key with its head shaped like a skull lies here.
A curled palimpsest rests on the ground.

extras.text: Fine lines radiate from coin-sized circles.  Within the circles is an area of nullity or nothingness which looks neither blank nor inscribed; they are simply empty.  The circles are connected by thin lines of ink in no obvious pattern. The shadows of bleached or erased incantations lie below, illegible.

objects.ground: A large chest of hardened wood lies here.
objects.action_desc: This chest is constructed of hardened wood with metal bands and fittings that add to its strength.  A small lock is set into the wood making the chest impossible to open without the proper key.

objects.ground: The decaying corpse of the groom lies here.
objects.action_desc: Against the eastern wall the slumped form of a man lies.  Long dead his skin has shriveled and begun to decay.  His finely tailored robes, though decaying, are obviously a type worn, centuries ago, by a groom on his wedding day.

objects.ground: A black dagger, covered in dried blood, lies on the floor.
A long slightly curving blade lies in the dust.

extras.text: Long and elegantly curved, this finely made shortsword gleams with the polishing it's been given.  Its hilt has short, curving, S-shaped crossguards, and a leather-wrapped hilt.

objects.ground: A sword apparently made of mist rests here.
A knotted yew staff leans against the wall.
Bracers formed like coiled serpents rest here.
A massive forked staff with barbed points rests against the wall.
A robe made of a coarse brown material lies here.
A dagger with the hilt of a snake lies in the dust.
A jerkin made of hardened, boiled leather lies here.
An open-faced helm with a red plume rests here.
A small green gem inside a golden amulet sparkles brightly.
A small golden ring fashioned like ivy leaves lies here.
A handful of gold pieces is hidden inside the chest!

extras.text: Even more valuable than gold, the small handful of platinum pieces hidden inside the chest amounts to a small fortune.  The coins sparkle in the light, the metal something between polished silver and burnished gold in coloration.  What a treasure!

objects.ground: A dark green stiletto sits here.

extras.text: This stiletto has a blade which is a very dark green color.  The blade is very thin, but is incredibly strong.  The hilt, a light tan color, seems to be made of tanned leather wrapped tightly around the dark green metal that makes up the blade.

objects.ground: A thick leather cuisse sits here.

extras.text: Used to protect the thighs from damage in a battle, a cuisse is a handy item to find.  The creature who has fashioned this piece of armor has created an item that can be worn on the legs, but attaches to the body like a skirt.

triggers.name: spider_rand
triggers.commands: * At a random chance attack a player in the room set rnd %random.char% if %rnd.level% < 100 if %rnd.vnum% == -1 kill %rnd.name% end end

triggers.name: sunken_rand_attack
triggers.commands: * At a random chance attack a player in the room set rnd %random.char% if %rnd.level% < 100 if %rnd.vnum% == -1 kill %rnd.name% else end else end

rooms.name: Castle Wall Corner
rooms.description: Rising out of the swamp are the remains of a massive castle wall.  Before you lies one corner of the wall, with the wall running south and east of here. Even crumbling and blackened by fire they still bar entrance into the interior. Plants have overgrown the wall in many areas indicating the walls have remained in a state of disrepair for a LONG, LONG time.  Strange.  There does not appear to be any structure behind the walls...

West.description: You see the Northern Swamps.

rooms.description: Rising out of the swamp before you are the remains of a massive castle wall which runs north to south.  Even crumbling and blackened by fire they still bar entrance into the interior. rooms.name: Crumbling Castle Walls
rooms.description: Rising out of the swamp are the remains of a massive castle wall.  This section of the wall has all but collapsed.  Rubble from the wall is spread out all over this area of the swamp.  Thick plant growth covers the wall in a blanket of green.  Moving aside the growth you can see that the collapsed wall offers a way into the interior...

rooms.name: Courtyard
rooms.description: There seems to be something solid under your feet for once and you can take refuge from the swamp on some solid ground here.  Partially buried in the muck you notice a rusted sword hilt, a blackened piece of leather, and shattered bone fragments.  All hint at some disaster the befell this place.  To the east you can see some sort of cylindrical structure.  Maybe the answer to this mystery lies there?

rooms.name: Near the Tower
rooms.description: Before you lies more of the swamp.  The castle walls all around you are the only indication that this was once a courtyard.  Immediately to the southeast you can see some sort of cylindrical structure...  It looks like a tower.

rooms.name: Near the Tower
rooms.description: Directly in front of you, to the east, lies a blackened, crumbling tower. Rising some 50 feet out the swamp, it looks like a watch tower of some sort. Slightly tilted it would appear to have settled into the swamp over the years. If this is the watch tower of a castle, where is the rest of the castle?

Hidden among the plant growth that hangs from the tower you notice a section of the wall that has crumbled away revealing a way into the gloomy darkness of the tower.

rooms.name: Watch Tower Entrance
rooms.description: Darkness, dust, and cobwebs cover everything inside the tower.  Broken bits of wood and rubble lie about in piles.  A single staircase, upon which you are standing is attached to the inner wall and winds its way up to the top of the watch tower.  However, more intriguing are the stairs that drop away into the even inkier darkness of below...

South.description: You see the Northern Swamps.

rooms.name: Watch Tower Stairs
rooms.description: Rubble and fallen wooden beams makes travel along the stairs difficult. The stairs leading up end at a trap door placed in the ceiling.  Stairs continue downward as well.

Up.description: The trapdoor is set into the ceiling and opens upward.

rooms.name: Top of Watch Tower
rooms.description: The top of the watch tower shows signs of continual use.  A fire-pit has been built near the center and surrounding it are crudely made straw mattresses.  Bits of bone and other rubble are piled up along southern end of the tower.  From here one has a commanding view of the entire courtyard.

Down.description: A small wooden trapdoor is set into the floor.

rooms.name: Watch Tower Stairs
rooms.description: The sound of dripping water echoes in the darkness.  The walls of the tower are broken and uneven as if the earth itself where trying to crush this tower. Water from the swamps seeps through the wall in places and a small stream runs down the stairs only to plummet over the edge into the darkness.  The stairs continue both up and down from here.

rooms.name: Watch Tower Stairs
rooms.description: The tower has nearly buckled here.  Large gaps in the stairs make travel slow and treacherous.  Large sections of the wall have crumbled away and in many areas the cold earth is visible.  Off to the west, just at the edge of the darkness, something catches your eye.  The remains of a window?  Why would someone place a window in an underground passage?  Off to the north, where a large section of the wall has crumbled away, a crude passageway seems to be dug into the earth.  The stairs continue up and down from here.

rooms.name: Watch Tower Stairs
rooms.description: Ice cold water streams through another window in the tower wall.  The presence of another window begins to confirm your suspicions.  This tower was not built underground...  Here the walls of the tower have almost total crumbled away.  Large uneven sections of earth have forced their way through the walls.  Cold and darkness grip you on all sides.  The stairs continue up and down from here.

rooms.name: Watch Tower Stairs
rooms.description: Rubble and earth block your descent.  It appears as if the earth has pinched the tower together at this point.  Rubble and debris, fallen from above, have formed an uneven floor where water has collected forming a small pool.  Water continues to trickle down from above, breaking the eerie silence.  Your only exit is back the way you came.

rooms.name: Earthen Tunnel
rooms.description: Damp cold earth surrounds you.  A crude uneven tunnel has been dug through the earth here.  In places the ceiling is supported by heavy wooden beams. Deathly silence clutches you from all sides.  The tunnel leads off to the east.

rooms.name: Earthen Tunnel
rooms.description: Damp cold earth surrounds you.  A crude uneven tunnel has been dug through the earth here.  In places the ceiling is supported by heavy wooden beams. The tunnel splits here.  Passages run east, west, and south.  The sounds of movement from the darkness sends chills down your spine.

rooms.name: Earth Room
rooms.description: The tunnel leads to a small room.  Huge piles of dirt and earth seem to illustrate that attempts to support the roof have failed.  The remains of a fire pit and litter strewn about the floor seem to hint that this room is still in use.

rooms.name: Earthen Tunnel
rooms.description: The tunnel abruptly ends at a curving stone wall with a large window set in it.  Is this another tower sunken into the swamp?

rooms.name: Tower Stairs
rooms.description: You are standing inside another tower.  Stairs lead down into the darkness below.  Above you the tower has crumbled, exposing the earth.  To the west a large window leads to darkness.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A small spiral staircase covered in dust and cobwebs descends down.  A landing is just visible to the north.

rooms.name: Stair Landing
rooms.description: Shadows seem to dance at the edge of visibility.  Humanoid bones, tattered cloth, and broken weapons lie in a pile along the west wall.  The floors and walls are blackened with soot.  Thick cobwebs hang from a vaulted ceiling overhead.  A cold chill blows through a broken doorway to the east.  A staircase to the south leads down into the darkness...

North.description: You see a blackened oak door.

rooms.name: Tower Stairs
rooms.description: The spiraling tower staircase comes to a end here.  Rubble and dirt litter the floor in huge piles.  The walls of the tower are blackened as if by a huge fire.  To the west a shattered blackened door creaks on a single hinge.

rooms.name: Lounge Room
rooms.description: This appears to have once been a plush lounge area but now it lies in ruin. It is obvious a fire once raced through this room.  Everything is covered in soot.  Footprints through the soot are everywhere in this room.  Once plush furniture is now nothing more than burnt wood and ash.  The north wall that once held a massive stained-glass window has collapsed into a pile of stone, earth, and shattered glass.  The room continues to the west.

South.description: You see a blackened oak door.

rooms.name: Lounge Room
rooms.description: For some reason the fire that destroyed the eastern half of the room never made it to this part of the room.  However, this room speaks of its own horror. The remains of human corpses lie about the room; their limbs torn from their bodies.  Dried blood covers everything in the room.  A deathly silence grips this room while death and decay assault your nostrils.  A door is placed in the south wall.  The room continues to the east.

South.description: Crudely carved into the door are the words, "DEATH AWAITS"

rooms.name: Familiar Room
rooms.description: Smashed furniture is thrown everywhere in this darkened room.  The shadows seem to dance and circle you while the silence rings in your ears.  Claw marks cover the walls and everything else in this room.  Soot and dried blood cover the walls and floor.  Humanoid bones litter the room in piles.  Doorways to the north and south offer the only exits from this room.

North.description: A door with many claw marks.

South.description: A simple door, most likely leading to a closet. Claw marks cover the door which has nearly splintered.

rooms.name: Closet
rooms.description: This small closet is filled with piles of rubble, burnt cloth, and bone fragments.

North.description: You see a simple closet door.

Down.description: Under a pile of rubble you see a small hole in the floor.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A small staircase spirals upward; an opening to the north leads to a hallway.

rooms.name: Guest Hallway
rooms.description: This hallway slopes downward sharply to the west and the walls are cracked and bulging in many places.  Broken stone from the walls and ceiling line the floor.  Water has seeped through the fractured walls and a trickle of water runs off to the west.  Eerie voices seem to come from the shadows.  The hallway continues to the west while stairways to the south and east lead up and down respectively.  An ornate oak door is to the north.

North.description: A brass plaque on this door has been mostly scratched out. All that can be made out is the following, "Li   r "

rooms.name: Guest Hallway
rooms.description: Twisted, sagging, and broken, this hallway is completely destroyed.  Huge piles of broken stonework litter the floor.  A small stream of ice-cold water snakes between the rubble and flows under a shattered door to the west. Another door is placed in what remains of the south wall.  The hallway continues to the east.

South.description: Although the doorway is fractured this sturdy oak door still bars entrance to the room beyond.

West.description: A splintering door creaks crazily on a single hinge.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A staircase of old wood descends down a stonework shaft.  With each step upon it, the wood strains underfoot, creaking and groaning.

rooms.name: Library
rooms.description: A low ceiling, supported by heavy beams, seems to press down on this room. Plush couches and overstuffed chairs are placed about the room.  Their fabric has faded over the ages; the prints nearly gone.  Bookcases filled with ancient dusty tomes line the walls.  The north wall has collapsed inward spilling the priceless texts all over the floor.  The library continues to the west.

rooms.name: Library
rooms.description: This section of the room survived the descent of the castle virtually intact.  Only a handful of old rotting tomes have fallen from the shelves. Fine carpets and plush chairs still decorate the room.  An eerie white light emanates from torches, still in their scones, that burn with a ghostly flame. A chill runs down your spine as you realize the flame gives off no heat!

rooms.name: Guest Room
rooms.description: This room must once have served to accommodate guests of the lords of the castle.  An elegant four posted bed lies against the west wall its sheets filled with holes.  A splintered table lies on a finely woven rug which covers the entire floor.  Cobwebs cling to everything here.  However it is obvious this room has seen use over the centuries.

East.description: A splintering door creaks crazily on a single hinge.

rooms.name: Guest Room
rooms.description: Someone took great pains to restore this room to the condition it existed in before the castle sunk into the swamp.  A bed is neatly made against the east wall.  A fine dresser and table are placed against the south wall.  Rich carpet covers the floor.

North.description: A sturdy oak door stands in a fractured doorway.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A staircase of old wood is affixed shakily to a stonework shaft.  With each step upon it, the wood strains underfoot, creaking and groaning.  The staircase leads both up and down.

rooms.name: Hallway
rooms.description: This narrow hallway has a dark vaulted ceiling.  Shadows seem to dance across the distant ceiling.  A low moan rises and falls the length of the corridor, intoning sadness and despair.  A layer of dust covers the floor, undisturbed for centuries...

rooms.name: Guard Post
rooms.description: From both sides of this narrow hallway deep alcoves of darkness silently face each other.  Within each, the crumpled remains of a fallen soldier can be made out.  Their flesh rotted away, only a hideous skeleton remains; their leather armor, rotting over the years, is filled with holes.  They seem to have been guarding the doorway to the west when they met their end.

West.description: You see a sturdy oak door.

rooms.name: Dining Hall
rooms.description: Dust fills your lungs, choking you.  The musty smell of death and decay swirls around you.  A long table of polished oak lies before you covered by a blanket of dust and debris.  In the center of the table a large cake leans heavily to one side, its once white frosting turned white with age.  Cobwebs drape like dusty lace down every side.  It is obvious no one has disturbed this room in centuries.  A shattered window and earthen rubble remind you that you are still underground.  The dining hall continues to the north.

East.description: You see a sturdy oak door.

rooms.name: Dining Hall
rooms.description: Stained yellow lace drapes the walls of this section of the room.  Cobwebs swirl around you and hinder sight.  Chairs have been arranged around the room as if in preparation for a banquet.  A layer of dust covers everything here. Against the eastern wall the slumped form of a man lies.  Long dead his skin has shriveled and begun to decay.  His finely tailored robes, though decaying, are obviously a type worn, centuries ago, by a groom on his wedding day.

North.description: This door is made of finely crafted wood with decorative brass fittings.

West.description: A simple door of fine wood with decorative metal bands.

rooms.name: Study
rooms.description: A huge desk of polished mahogany stands in the center of the room.  The walls are lined with ancient tomes.  Their leather covers rot and crack from a lack of oiling over the centuries.  Light from a fireplace to the east casts an eerie illumination in this room.  Shadows seem to dance across the walls. Doorways are positioned to the west and south.  A staircase to the north leads down into the heart of the castle.  This room continues to the east.

South.description: This door is made of finely crafted wood with decorative brass fittings.

West.description: Rich, detailed carvings adorn the rich wood of the doorway before you. The hinges suffering from a lack of oil have most likely 'frozen' in place. It is doubtful you would be able to open this door even if you did possess the key to unlock it.

rooms.name: Fireplace
rooms.description: A blazing hearth fire, from a fireplace set along the east wall, fills this room with rolling waves of red and amber light.  The stone floor is hidden beneath a luxurious rug of bear fur.  Three plush chairs face the heart.  A huge painting hangs over the mantlepiece.  Masterfully rendered, it shows the likeness of a young man and woman, obviously very much in love.  A thick layer of undisturbed dust covers everything in the room.  If no one has been in this room in centuries why is the fireplace still burning?  A door is set into the north wall.  The room continues to the west.

North.description: A stout wooden door of simple design is placed in a simple doorway made of polished wood.

East.description: You notice a false panel in the rear of the fireplace.

rooms.name: King's Bedroom
rooms.description: Rotting cloth and dusty cobwebs assault your senses.  Heavy purple curtains line the west wall.  Shattered glass and broken stone indicate that there was once huge windows along that wall.  Obviously they did not survive the descent of the castle.  A large bed canopied by yellowed rotting silken curtains is positioned with its headboard against the north wall.  Small tables and spent candles are placed about the room.  Undisturbed, this room has lain for centuries.  Doors to the east and south offer the only exits from this room.

North.description: You notice that a section of the wall pivots.

East.description: Rich, detailed carvings adorn the rich wood of the doorway before you. The hinges suffering from a lack of oil have most likely 'frozen' in place. It is doubtful you would be able to open this door even if you did possess the key to unlock it.

rooms.name: Bathing Room
rooms.description: In the center of this room a large, ornate ivory bathtub lies sunken into the floor.  Cobwebs drape from the ceiling and dust covers everything.  Lying in the middle of the room is the decaying corpse of a young woman.  It appears as though the cause of death was a slit throat.

East.description: A simple door of fine wood with decorative metal bands.

rooms.name: Closet
rooms.description: A musty smell of rotting and decaying cloth permeates through this room. Bits of cloth that once must have been finely tailored robes and cloaks hang from the many pegs and hooks that line the walls.  Cobwebs hang from all corners of the room.

rooms.name: Secret Passageway
rooms.description: This small hallway offers a secret entrance for the maid into the King's Bedchamber.  Dust and cobwebs fill the narrow corridor.

North.description: It looks like the back-side of a rotating wall.

South.description: You see the back-side of a panel. A secret door perhaps?

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: This spiraling staircase of ancient stone is worn smooth through use in ages long forgotten.  Dust lies on the floor and dry cobwebs choke its passage.

rooms.name: Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway leads north.  To the south the hallway ends in a doorway. Dust blankets the floor while a mass of cobwebs hang from the ceiling.  No one has traveled through this hallway in centuries.

South.description: A stout wooden door of simple design is placed in a simple doorway made of polished wood.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase Landing
rooms.description: This small vaulted corridor serves as a landing for the great spiral staircase to the east.  Hallways lead off to the west and south.  A path through the dust indicates that this hallway has been used recently and frequently.  The path runs east to west.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: You find yourself in a huge, vast, empty tower.  A spiraling staircase both rises and descends from here, circling the open shaft.  Thick cobwebs fill the tower.  However, someone or something has made a path through the dust and cobwebs from this point leading down the stairs.  The staircase rises to the north and descends to the south.

rooms.name: Hall of Statues
rooms.description: Long, low moans drift from alcoves that line both walls of this long hall that continues off to the west.  The ceiling has collapsed here spreading earth and rubble across the floor.  A statue stands in each of the four alcoves that line this section of the hallway.  You notice their faces formed into the shapes of terrified men and women.  You notice a path through the dust that runs east to west.

rooms.name: Hall of Statues
rooms.description: A hallway with deep alcoves begins here and continues to the east.  In each alcove is a statue, a terrified look chiseled into their faces.  To the west a narrow staircase drops away into the darkness.  A path through the dust shows that this hallway is still in use...

South.description: A section of the wall pivots.

rooms.name: Servant's Staircase
rooms.description: This narrow stairway descends along grey, dusty stones.  Someone has traveled through here recently.

rooms.name: Bell Tower Hallway
rooms.description: This ancient hallway is choked by patches of spider webs.  Their dusty forms hide the walls and ceiling from view.  The hallway continues to the east.

rooms.name: Bell Tower Hallway
rooms.description: This ancient hallway is choked by patches of spider webs.  Their dusty forms hide the walls and ceiling from view.  The hallway ends at a pair of huge bronze double doors to the east.  The hallway continues to the west.

East.description: Huge bronze double doors of a highly ornate design block your way.

rooms.name: Belfry
rooms.description: Dusty cobwebs fill the area, their musty smell assaulting your senses and obscuring sight.  Deep pools of darkness lie all about you as you attempt in vain to penetrate the spidery veils.  A single path leads to the center of the room where a rope dangles from high above.

North.description: A mysterious keyhole is positioned in the wall.

West.description: Huge bronze double doors of a highly ornate design stand before you.

rooms.name: Treasure Room
rooms.description: A huge circular room with a domed ceiling surrounds you.  Dust and cobwebs indicate that no one has entered this room in centuries.  Frescos once decorated this room but their images have long faded past recognition.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: This staircase spirals around the inside of the tower.  After about twenty steps the staircase falls away.  Just at the edge of darkness you can see that the tower was 'pinched' closed when the castle descended into the swamp.  Your only exit is back down the stairs to the south.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: Spiraling around the inside of the tower, this stairway leads down.  A landing is to the north.

rooms.name: Archer's Post
rooms.description: Centuries ago archers defended the castle from here.  Very little of the walls remain.  The descent of the castle crumbled the walls; moist uneven earth forms a little cave here.  Broken stone lies about the floor.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: Blackened stone forms a narrow hallway that leads east and west from here. Blackened timber, ash, and dust line the floor.  The darkness seems especially oppressive here.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway with an arched roof leads east and west from here.  Heavy timbers support the stone roof.  Rubble from the walls is scattered about the hallway.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway with an arched ceiling leads west.  To the east the landing to the great spiral staircase can just be made out through the darkness.

South.description: A strange handle is built into the wall.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase Landing
rooms.description: You find yourself in a vast open tower.  A staircase, attached to the inner wall of the tower, spirals the open shaft.  The stairway descends to the south and rises to the east.  To the west a hallway leads into darkness.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: Spiraling around the inside of the tower, this stairway leads up.  A landing is to the west.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: Spiraling around the inside wall of the tower this stairway leads down.  To the north is a landing.

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway Corner
rooms.description: The hallway arrives at a corner and leaves both west and south from here. A path through the dust on the floor leads in both directions...  And also to the north.

North.description: It would appear that a section of this wall can be pressed inward.

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway made of smooth grey stones leads east and west from here. Someone or something has made a path through the dust.

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway runs east into the darkness.  Damp grey stones seem to press in around you...  Restricting you.  A path through the dust leads east. A small doorway is set into the south wall.  To the west a staircase rises into obscurity.

South.description: A simple door made of oak is set into the wall. Nothing on the door betrays what could lie beyond.

rooms.name: Servant's Staircase
rooms.description: This narrow stairway ascends along grey, dusty stones.  To the east a hallway vanishes into the darkness.  Someone has travelled here recently.

rooms.name: Servant's Quarters
rooms.description: Stained and yellowing lace hangs neatly from 3 canopied beds.  A small, broken table rests crazily against the wall on only three legs.  Cobwebs drape from the ceiling, but someone has cleared a path to the far end of the room. The room continues to the east.

rooms.name: Servant's Quarters
rooms.description: This section of the room is filled with rotting straw that has been bunched together into five distinct piles.  Someone may be using these for crude mattresses.  Broken bed frames litter the floor.  Dust filled cobwebs hang from the corners of this room.  The only exit is back to the west.

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway of damp, smooth, stones heads both north and south into the darkness.  A path through the blanket of dust that covers the floor indicates that this hallway still sees frequent use.

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway of damp, smooth, grey stones heads north into the darkness. A path through the layer of dust that covers the floor indicates this hallway still sees frequent use.

South.description: You can make out the vague outline of a door among the stones in this wall.

rooms.name: Guard Room
rooms.description: This small room must have functioned as a guard post at one time.  Deep alcoves flank a huge double-door along the west wall.  To the east another set of double-doors silently stands in the cold darkness.  A tiny doorway, seemingly forgotten, penetrates the south wall.

North.description: You seem to make out the vague outline of a door along this wall.

East.description: Huge double doors of finely carved wood stand firm against the ages. The carvings on the door seem to depict holy men and women, their names long forgotten.

South.description: A door made of simple yet elegant design proudly bars any exit to the south.

West.description: Massive double doors that form a single arch at their top when closed stand before you. Their height is well over ten feet tall and bands of rich metal adorn its edges. The center of the door is dominated by a carving of what can only be this castle when it once stood proudly on the surface.

rooms.name: Throne Room
rooms.description: This immense room stands in chilly, brooding darkness.  Thousands of dust- thick cobwebs drape from all corners of this room; the ceiling hidden from view.  The west wall has collapsed into a pile of rubble; bare-earth now forms the west wall.  Moisture clings to the walls.  To the north a huge staircase descends further into the cold and darkness.  Along the east wall are a set of double doors.  The room continues to the south.

East.description: Huge double doors well over ten feet in height stand before you. Rich metal bands decorate the door and the center is dominated by a carving of what can only be this castle when it once stood proudly on the surface.

rooms.name: Great Staircase
rooms.description: At one time this immense stairway was probably one of the most attractive points in the castle.  Rich, red carpet lined these wide stairs.  Finely chiseled marble hand rails and numerous huge crystal chandeliers completed the stairway.  Now it lies in ruins.  The crystal chandeliers lie smashed on the steps, thousands of crystal shards litter the stairs.  In many places the stairs are cracked from falling rubble which is strewn across the floor. Somehow darkness and silence seem appropriate for this once great stairway.

rooms.name: Dais
rooms.description: A huge throne sits atop a raised dais.  A small door is set into the east wall.  The room is damp and chilly.  A strange fungus grows on the walls. Huge piles of rubble are strewn about the floor.

East.description: This door is set into a small alcove making it only visible from up on the dais.

South.description: Behind a partially rotting banner you notice a small door set into the wall. It does not contain a handle so you can only guess it opens outward.

rooms.name: Hall of Grace
rooms.description: This wide hallway has a dark, vaulted ceiling.  Shadows seem to dance across the distant ceiling.  A low moan rises out of the silence.  It appears to be coming from the east.  But who could tell?

West.description: Huge double doors of finely carved wood stand firm against the ages. The carvings on the door seem to depict holy men and women, their names long forgotten.

rooms.name: Hall of Grace
rooms.description: Once adorned with colorful frescos, the walls are now faded and covered in a strange fungus.  The air is dense and choking.  A low moan pierces the silence. The hallway ends at a huge double-door to the east.  To the west the hallway continues into the darkness.

rooms.name: Royal Balcony
rooms.description: You are standing on a huge balcony that overlooks the castle chapel below. Two huge thrones that once stood here can be seen in the rubble below.  A decomposing human corpse lies crumpled on floor.  He is dressed in a rotting guard's uniform.  Dried blood stains the floor.  Part of the railing has broken away; it might be possible to lower yourself to the chapel below.  The balcony continues north and south.  Double doors are to the west.

rooms.name: Royal Balcony
rooms.description: It was here that important guests of the king or queen would enjoy mass with the royal couple.  Now everything lies silent, covered in a blanket of dust. A stairway to the chapel below is to the west.  The balcony continues to the south.

rooms.name: Royal Balcony
rooms.description: It was here that important guests of the king or queen would enjoy mass with the royal couple.  Now everything lies silent, covered in a blanket of dust. The balcony continues to the north.

rooms.name: Chapel Stairs
rooms.description: An ancient wooden stairway filled with dust and cobwebs descends to the chapel below. An archway leads off east.

rooms.name: Briefing Room
rooms.description: Dusty tomes and scrolls line the walls of this room and are strewn about the floors.  This may have once been a briefing room for the king.  However, it now lies in ruins much like the castle around it.  Footprints in the dust indicate this room is still in use.  Doorways are positioned north and west.  A spiral staircase is to the east.

North.description: A door of simple yet elegant design bars any exit to the north.

West.description: This door bears a brass plaque which reads, 'The King Awaits.' Besides the plaque it is a rather uninteresting door that has faired the ages rather well.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A staircase of old wood is affixed shakily to a stonework shaft.  With each step upon it, the wood strains underfoot, creaking and groaning.  The staircase leads both up and down.

rooms.name: Guard's Staircase
rooms.description: An old, rotting wooden staircase is attached to a stone framework and leads deeper into the castle.  The wood has rotted because of a small stream of water that runs down the steps.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: Rubble and earth litter this narrow hallway.  The south wall has collapsed in many places exposing the cold, damp earth.  A small stream of icy water flows west; it seems to be coming from the east.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: A trickle of water seeps through the buckled wall to the south and runs in a small stream to the east.  A narrow hallway with an arched ceiling leads both east and west.

extras.text: The smooth door along the north wall appears to have been designed to only be opened from the other side. There is no handle and it appears the door opens inward.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: This narrow hallway is choked with dusty cobwebs.  A vaulted ceiling seems to press down on you.  Dust layers the floor; however, someone has made a path through both the dust and the cobwebs.

rooms.name: Archer's Post
rooms.description: This is where archers used to defend the castle.  Dirt has poured through the arrow slits and covers the floor.  However, over the centuries, the narrow arrow slits have become clogged with dirt and silt.  Everything is silent here.

rooms.name: Archer's Post
rooms.description: At one time archers used to defend the keep from here.  The walls must have buckled when the castle descended because earth and broken stone cover the floor in huge piles.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: This spiraling staircase of ancient stone is worn smooth through use in ages long forgotten.  Dust lies on the floor and dry cobwebs choke its passage.

rooms.name: Great Staircase Landing
rooms.description: The massive stairs arrive at a huge landing.  Stone arches support a ceiling covered with frescos.  Faces in the frescos are scratched beyond recognition. Dust floats in the air here making it difficult to see.  There are two alcoves set into the north wall.  The grand staircase rises up from here and descends to the east.

rooms.name: Great Staircase
rooms.description: This once glorious staircase bends here.  Leading west to a small landing and down to the great entrance hall.  The marbled hand rails have are broken and line the staircase as rubble.  A fallen chandelier has covered the floor with tiny shards of crystal.  Strangely one statue along the wall seems perfectly intact.  It stares back at you with an impish grin.

rooms.name: Pool Room
rooms.description: At one time archers used to defend the keep from here.  However, the thick walls of this room have completed crumbled exposing the bare earth.  This room is roughly circular in shape.  Broken pieces of stone and other rubble from the collapsed walls has been arranged in a circular formation around a strange pool of water.  A slight glow emanates from deep within the pool casting eerie shadows across the walls.  Your feet seem to sink into the damp earth.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: You are standing in a narrow hallway once used by the guards of this castle. Its plain stone walls are covered in dust and cobwebs hang everywhere.  The hallway runs east to west.

rooms.name: Archer's Post
rooms.description: Little remains to prove that this was once a post where archer's defended the castle.  Rubble and earth cover this room in huge piles.  The air is very humid making it hard to breath.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: You are standing in a narrow hallway once used by the guards of the castle. Its plain stone walls are covered in dust and cobwebs hang everywhere.  The hallway runs east to west.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: You are standing in a narrow hallway once used by the guards of this castle. Its plain stone walls are covered in dust and cobwebs hang everywhere.  The hallway runs east to west.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: You are standing in a narrow hallway that was once used by the guards of this castle.  Its plain stone walls are covered in dust and cobwebs hang everywhere.  The hallway runs east to west.  To the south a small staircase descends into the darkness.

rooms.name: Servant's Passageway
rooms.description: This narrow passageway allowed the servants coming from the servant's entrance to the east to ascend the great spiral staircase to the south without disturbing the lords of the castle.  Now it lies in dark silence, unused in ages.  Another hallway leads west from here.

rooms.name: Servant's Entrance
rooms.description: At one time the servants used this entrance to enter the castle.  Now the east wall that once held the doorway has collapses in a pile of rubble and earth.  A broken table and bits of rotting cloth litter the floor.  A small passageway leads west from here.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: This spiraling staircase of ancient stone is worn smooth through use in ages long forgotten.  Dust lies on the floor and dry cobwebs choke its passage. Fallen rubble has nearly blocked all passage here along the stairs.

rooms.name: Guard's Staircase
rooms.description: A rickety wooden staircase leads down to a lower level of the castle. Black soot covers the floor and the staircase shows sign that it survived a fire that raced through this stairwell.  Although judging from the look of the staircase it just barely survived.

rooms.name: Great Spiral Staircase Landing
rooms.description: You find yourself in vast tower that rises up into the darkness.  You can feel the heavy weight of the tower pressing down on top of you.  A stair- case spirals along the inside wall of tower leading up into the inky blackness. You can see a passageway to the north.

rooms.name: Servant's Staircase
rooms.description: A narrow staircase of worn grey stones descends sharply into the darkness.

rooms.name: Great Staircase
rooms.description: At one time this staircase was probably one of the most attractive spots in the castle.  Marbled hand rails, rich red carpet, great crystal chandeliers, and fine statues in small alcoves all added to the appeal of this stairway. The descend into the swamp destroyed much of this.  The staircase is now cracked and uneven.  One chandelier hangs crazily on one of the three chains that once supported it, the other lies shattered on the floor.  The statues lie smashed and broken on the steps.  This above all else points at the catastrophe that befell this place.

rooms.name: Chapel Stairs
rooms.description: An ancient wooden stairway filled with dusty cobwebs climbs up to the balcony overhead.

rooms.name: North Chapel Alcove
rooms.description: This arched room leads to a vast chamber to the south, and a rising staircase to the west.  Alcoves in the north and east walls open into this room.  With the dark murky confines of the alcoves lurk huge shadowy figures. Their stone forms show muscled arms and legs.  Dark shadows fall across their faces, obscuring them from sight.

rooms.name: Castle Chapel
rooms.description: Before you lies the chapel of this ancient castle.  Pews and benches lie about the floor in jumbled disarray, coated with centuries of dust.  Two large thrones lie in the rubble, totally out of place.  A long balcony along the south wall overlooks this room.  Bits of stained- glass cover everything; the windows apparently shattering when the castle sank into the swamp.  To the north and south you see chapel alcoves.  The altar is to the east and double-doors lead west.

West.description: Huge doors of bronze are covered with various scenes of rather pious looking people praying with their arms raised toward the sky.

rooms.name: South Chapel Alcove
rooms.description: This arched room leads to a vast chamber to the north.  Alcoves are positioned in the south and east walls.  Huge figures, cloaked in shadows lurk in the cold, dark confines of the alcoves.  Bright blades clutched firmly in their muscled arms.  Dark shadows obscure their faces.

rooms.name: Chapel Altar
rooms.description: Before you lies the altar of this once proud and mighty castle.  It somehow seems to defy the fate that has befallen the rest of the castle; it stands untouched by the ages, free of dust and decay.  A sense of peace surrounds you here.

rooms.name: Hall of Kings
rooms.description: This dark dank hallway ends in a pair of huge bronze double-doors to the east.  The walls are covered with faded frescos which seem to portray the great deeds of the former kings of this castle.  You cannot help but wonder of all those deeds where in vain.  The hallway continues to the west.

East.description: Huge doors of bronze are covered with various scenes of rather pious looking people praying with their arms raised toward the sky.

rooms.name: Hall of Kings
rooms.description: This wide dark hallway leads eastward into the gloomy heart of the castle. Statues, most likely of former kings, line the halls covered in centuries of dust and decay.  They seem to watch you as you pass by.  One in particular catches your attention.

West.description: Huge doors of bronze tower above you. Across the surface of both doors a huge landscape depicts what the surrounding countryside once looked like countless centuries ago. A huge fertile valley dominates the landscape and in the center a glorious castle rises like a beacon of hope and refuge

rooms.name: Great Entrance Hall
rooms.description: Cobwebs covered with ages of dust hang from columns of this great hall. Shadows seem to dance across the faces of four stone gargoyles, each squatting motionlessly on the rim of the domed ceiling.  Huge bronze double-doors stand closed to the east.  A wide staircase to the north climbs up into the darkness. A dark hallway retreats to the south.

East.description: Huge doors of bronze tower before you. Across the surface of both a huge landscape depicts what the surrounding countryside once looked like countless centuries ago. A huge fertile valley dominates the landscape and in the center a glorious castle rises like a beacon of hope and refuge.

rooms.name: Guest's Hallway
rooms.description: This small vaulted hallway leads off from the entrance hall to the north. A thick layer of dust covers the floor, disturbed in many places.  A stairway to the west spirals up and down.  Large wooden doors stand slightly open to the east.

West.description: Huge wooden ornately carved with images of feasting tower above you.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A staircase of old wood is affixed shakily to a stonework shaft.  With each step upon it, the wood strains underfoot, creaking and groaning.  The staircase leads both up and down.

rooms.name: Guest's Dining Hall
rooms.description: This massive room was once lit by three large chandeliers which now lie smashed on the marble floor.  A long wooden table in the center of the room was broken in two by one of the chandeliers.  Rubble, dust, and cobwebs are your only companions here.

East.description: Huge wooden doors ornately carved with images of feasting tower above you.

rooms.name: Archer's Post
rooms.description: At one time archers defended the castle from here.  The wall must have buckled when the castle descended for earth and broken stone cover the floor in huge piles.  All is silent here.

rooms.name: Archer's Post
rooms.description: This is where the archers used to defend the castle.  The narrow arrow slits are now clogged with muck and dirt.  Darkness and silence surround you here.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: Cobwebs drape from the ceiling limiting sigh to a few feet.  Unlike the rest of the hallway it appears as though no one has traveled through here in ages. Doors are set into the north and west wall, while the hallway continues to the east.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway runs east and west from here.  Many of the heavy beams that once supported the arched roof have collapsed and now litter the floor.  It would appear as though a section of the ceiling has buckled.

rooms.name: Guard's Passageway
rooms.description: This narrow hallway has an arched roof supported by heavy beams.  The air is incredibly moist causing the torch scones to rust.

rooms.name: Guard's Staircase
rooms.description: An old, rotting wooden staircase is attached to a stone framework.  The wood has rotted because of a small stream of water that trickles down the steps. Cobwebs choke this stairway that leads both up and down.  A narrow hallway leads off to the west.

rooms.name: Kingsman's Quarters
rooms.description: These small quarters once housed the most trusted protector of the king. It looks as if a whirlwind once raced through this room.  Furniture is thrown about the room and rests against the wall at strange angles.  Shields and swords jut from the stone walls as if driven there by some tremendous force. A great penetrating evil surrounds you here.

West.description: The rough outline of a door can be made out among the stones in this wall.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: This spiraling staircase of ancient stone is worn smooth though use in ages long forgotten.  Cobwebs choke its passage and dust covers the floor.

rooms.name: Kingsman Hall
rooms.description: This entire room is covered in black soot.  A powerful fire must have once raced through this room.  Burnt and broken furniture is scattered about the room.  Blackened armor and weapons lie in piles.  Broken bones lies scattered among the ruin.

North.description: Unlike the door along the south wall this door survived the fire mostly intact. Although blackened by the fire it owes it survival to the thick metal bands the outline the door.

South.description: The door in this wall has been badly blackened by the fire that raced through this room. It now hangs on only one hinge.

rooms.name: Guard's Staircase
rooms.description: A rickety wooden staircase leads up into the darkness.  Black soot covers the walls and in many places the staircase show signs that it survived a dire that raced through this narrow stairwell, although just barely.

rooms.name: Guard's Hall
rooms.description: This section of the room lies in total chaos; broken bones lie scattered amid the crumpled and crushed plate armor and shields.  A large oaken table, bearing deep cuts in its surface, stands in the middle of the room.  The hallway continues to the south.

North.description: The door set into this wall has been badly blackened by fire. It now swings crazily on only one hinge.

rooms.name: Butler's Quarters
rooms.description: This small room is completely bare.  Only dust and cobwebs occupy this room. A small pile of straw, possibly a mattress, lies in the northwest corner of this room.

rooms.name: Castle Kitchen
rooms.description: A horrible odor assaults your senses as you enter this huge room.  A dark cold fireplace is positioned in the north wall.  A huge table, covered with various rusting utensils stands in the center of the room.  Large, black iron pots are placed against the west wall.  An ominous presence seems to grip this room.

rooms.name: Servant's Staircase
rooms.description: A narrow staircase of worn grey stones climbs through a veil of darkness and cobwebs.  A hallway is visible to the south.

rooms.name: Guard's Hall
rooms.description: Chilly darkness presses in around you.  Large wooden tables, crushed and splintered, seem haphazardly placed around the room.  Dark stains of dried blood cover the floor and walls.  Broken swords, crumpled helmets and shields are scattered around the room.  The hallway continues to the north.  Doorways are to the east and south.

East.description: This wide door has been reinforced with metal bands. It does not seem to fit in the doorway properly. It appears as if some great force had slammed into the door at one time.

South.description: A narrow door made of oak is set into the wall. Cut marks, as if made by a sword, cover this side of the door.

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway
rooms.description: A constricting hallway made of grey dusty stones runs east and west from here.  A small doorway set in the north wall is covered over with centuries of cobwebs.

North.description: This small doorway is covered in cobwebs and dust. It is unlikely that anyone has opened this door in centuries.

West.description: This wide door has been reinforced with metal bands. It does not seem to fit into the doorway properly. It would appear that some great force had slammed into the door.

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway cloaked in darkness runs to the east and west.  The hallway is made of grey stones which have become slippery because of all the moisture in the castle.  Cobwebs have nearly obscured a doorway in the north wall.

North.description: A plain oaken door showing the signs of centuries of age is set in a stone door frame. A plaque on the door reads, 'Kit hen'

rooms.name: Servant's Hallway
rooms.description: A narrow hallway leads off to the west from here.  A small staircase rises steeply to the north.  To the east an old rotten door is set in a stone frame.

East.description: This wooden door is covered in a layer of moisture. Sickly green lichen covers the door in a think layer. The moisture has begun to warp the wood.

rooms.name: Wine Cellar
rooms.description: The huge wooden beams that once supported the low arched ceiling of this cellar have collapsed, shattering many of the huge casks that line the walls. Broken wood and stone from the crumbling ceiling cover the floor.  The wine cellar continues to the south.

rooms.name: Wine Cellar
rooms.description: Arched frames of stone form a low wet ceiling over this wine cellar.  Great wooden casks of wine line the walls.  Some are broken, their contents long since spilled in the floor.  Cobwebs block vision beyond a few feet.  The darkness seems to press in around you.  The cellar continues to the north.

rooms.name: Guard's Run
rooms.description: Sickly green lichen covers the ceiling of this wide passageway that runs south from here.  To the north a door blocks passage.  An narrow arched hallway runs east.  A deathly silence permeates the room.

North.description: A narrow door made of oak is set into the wall. It's simple design makes it impossible to judge what is in the room beyond.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: A staircase of old wood is affixed shakily to a stonework shaft.  With each step upon it, the wood stains underfoot, creaking and groaning.  The staircase leads north.  A narrow arched hallway leads west.

rooms.name: Guard's Staircase
rooms.description: An old, rotting wooden staircase is attached to a stone framework.  The wood has rotted because of a small stream of water that trickles down the steps. Cobwebs choke this stairway that leads both up and down.  A narrow arched hallway leads west.

rooms.name: Guard's Run
rooms.description: A sickly green lichen covers the ceiling of this hallway.  A spiral staircase to the east leads both up and down.  A door to the west seems to lead to the guard's quarters.  The hallway leads north.

West.description: A thick oaken door reinforced with metal bands is set into a stone door frame. A brass plaque that once identified the room beyond has been scratched out, as if by some savage beast.

rooms.name: Guard's Quarters
rooms.description: A sickly green lichen covers the ceiling of this ten foot wide passage that runs off to the west.  Opening off to both sides of this passage way are large ten-foot-square alcoves.  Rotting cloth and rags are in the darkness of each alcove.  An eerie silence permeates this hallway.

rooms.name: Guard's Quarters
rooms.description: A sickly green lichen covers the walls and ceiling of this wide hallway. Opening off to both sides of this hallway are ten-foot-square alcoves. Rotting cloth and rags can be made in the darkness of each alcove.  In one the rooting corpse of a human lies slumped against the wall.  A deathly silence fills the hall, sending a shiver down your spine.

rooms.name: Kingsman's Stairway
rooms.description: A narrow stairwell descends into the darkness.

East.description: It would appear that a section of the wall can pivot inwards.

rooms.name: Kingsman's Stairway
rooms.description: A narrow constricting stairway rises sharply into the darkness.

South.description: A simple door made of oak is set into the wall. Nothing on the door betrays what could lie beyond.

rooms.name: Spiral Staircase
rooms.description: This spiraling staircase of ancient stone ends at a door set into the south wall.  The air seems especially humid here making it very difficulty to breath.

South.description: A simple door made of oak is set into the wall. Nothing on the door betrays what could lie beyond.

rooms.name: Brazier Room
rooms.description: This room is well lit by the brazier in the eastern section of this room. High up on the arched roof two huge gargoyles stare down at you, an impish smile carved in their face.  The only visible exists from this room are a door in the north wall and the rest of the room to the east.

North.description: A simple door made of oak is set into the wall. Nothing on the door betrays what could lie beyond.

rooms.name: Brazier Room
rooms.description: This huge room rises to an arched roof over twenty feet overhead.  In the center of this section of the room a huge brazier burns fiercely.  High overhead gargoyles smile down on you.  The room continues to the west.  You notice a door on the north wall and a black curtain on the south wall.

North.description: A simple door made of oak is set into the wall. Nothing on the door betrays what could lie beyond.

East.description: It looks as though a section of the wall can be pushed inward.

rooms.name: Observation Balcony
rooms.description: There are two large thrones on this balcony.  A tattered and torn black curtain covers a passageway north.  From here the lords of the castle could oversee the torture of prisoners.  Below the balcony to the south is the torture, which can be reached by a set of stairs to the west.  Water has collected here over the centuries and the torture room to the south is now filled with dark, cold water.

rooms.name: Flooded Stairs
rooms.description: This was once the stairway that connected the torture chamber to the south with the observation balcony to the east.  Now all but a few steps are below water.  The dark waters must rise a good 10 feet off the floor.  Dark shapes can be made out in the water.

rooms.name: Flooded Torture Chamber
rooms.description: This entire room lies sunken beneath dark forbidding water.  The strange shapes of various torture devices can be made out through the water.  Along the south wall, just the water level, a rotting hand is attached to a wall manacle; the rest of the body must lie underwater.

rooms.name: Flooded Torture Chamber
rooms.description: The dark shapes of various torture devices can be made out through the forbidding water that continues to rise slowly over the centuries.

rooms.name: Flooded Hallway
rooms.description: This hallway lies under six or seven feet of water.  The roof only a few feet over head makes travel slow and dangerous.  The water is dark here, unwilling to reveal any secrets hidden underwater.  The hallway continues to the east and west.  Two smaller hallways lead off to the north and south.

rooms.name: Flooded Cells
rooms.description: Judging by the bars that rise out of the water in various places around this narrow hallway this would appear to be were the prisoners were kept.  There seems to be five small cells along both the east and west walls.  However, the bars prevent any entrance.

rooms.name: Flooded Cells
rooms.description: Judging by the bars that rise out of the water it would seem that this where the prisoners were kept.  There seems to be five cells along the east and west walls.  However, the bars prevent any entrance.  The only exit is back the way you came.

rooms.name: Flooded Staircase
rooms.description: The wooden staircase ends at a flooded hallway.  The trickle of water empties out into the flooded hallway.  Only about a 4 foot section of the hallway is above water which seems to have flooded the entire lower section of the castle.  The only way seems to be back up the way you came.

rooms.name: Secret Hallway
rooms.description: You find yourself in a dark, damp hallway made of rough hewn stones that leads off to the north.  A layer of thick fog clings to the floor; it seems to clutch at your ankles.

West.description: It appears as if a section of the wall can be pushed in here.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Secret Hallway
rooms.description: This dark hallway made of rough hewn stones leads off south and east from here.  A low layer of fog clings to the floor, clutching at your ankles.

rooms.name: Secret Hallway
rooms.description: This hallway made of rough hewn stones runs east to west.  A layer of fog covers the floor, clinging to your ankles.

rooms.name: Secret Hallway
rooms.description: This hallway made of rough hewn stones runs east to west.  A layer of fog covers the floor, clinging to your ankles.

rooms.name: Secret Hallway
rooms.description: This hallway made of rought hewn stones ends at a door to the east.  To the west the hallway retreats into the darkness.  The fog seems to be coming from under the door...

East.description: A heavy door made of blackened wood stands in thick stone frame. A rusting metal plaque bears an inscription which you can just make out, "May all who lie here find peace."

rooms.name: Crypt (NW)
rooms.description: An arched ceiling sags over squat crypts forming a maze of catacombs.  A thick fog clings to the floor at knee height.  A layer of icy water covers the floor up to your ankles.  Cobwebs hang limp in the musty air.  Thick dust has settled over everything making it difficult to read the names of those buried here.

West.description: A heavy door made of blackened wood stands before you. A rusting metal plaque bears an inscription which you can just make out, "May all who lie here find peace."

rooms.name: Crypt (N)
rooms.description: An arched ceiling sags over squat crypts forming a maze of catacombs.  A thick fog clings to the floor at knee height.  A layer of icy water covers the floor up to your ankles.  Thick dust has settled over everything making it difficult to read the names of those buried here.  A few of the heavy stone doors of the catacombs have been ripped off, as if by some tremendous force, and now lie scattered about this section of the room.

rooms.name: Crypt (NE)
rooms.description: Thick fog clings to the floor at knee height of this section of the crypt. Icy water clutches at your ankles.  All around is silence and the feeling of death!  Dusty cobwebs hang limply in the musty air.

rooms.name: Crypt (W)
rooms.description: An arched ceiling sags over squat crypts forming a maze of catacombs.  A thick fog clings to the floor at knee height.  A layer of icy water covers the floor up to your ankles.

rooms.name: Crypt (Center)
rooms.description: An arched ceiling sags over squat crypts forming a maze of catacombs.  A thick fog clings to the floor at knee height.  A layer of icy water covers the floor up to your ankles.  Some of the crypts have been knocked over to the south baring any exit in that direction.  A sinister feeling surrounds you here.

rooms.name: Crypt (E)
rooms.description: An arched ceiling overhead sags over squat crypts forming a maze of catacombs.  A thick fog clings to the floor at knee height.  A layer of icy water covers the floor up to your ankles.  Cobwebs hang limp in the musty air. A thick layer of dust has settled over everything making it difficult to read the names of those buried here.

rooms.name: Crypt (SW)
rooms.description: The fog is much thicker here and rises off the floor to waist level.  It is pouring into this room from a crack in the ceiling and from here must spread out to the rest of the catacombs.  The ground feels uneven here and the fog seems to swirl around you.  The squat crypts rise out the fog like black sentinels.  Icy water clings to your feet.

rooms.name: Crypt (S)
rooms.description: An arched roof sags over squat crypts forming a maze of catacombs.  A thick fog clings to the floor at knee height.  Icy water covers the floor up to your ankles.  The fog seems to flowing off to the south.

rooms.name: Crypt (SE)
rooms.description: Part of the arched roof overhead has collapsed crushing many of the crypts here and spilling their decaying contents on the fog covered floor.  Icy water clutches at your ankles.  A feeling of dread sends a shiver through your body.

rooms.name: Lizard King's Lair
rooms.description: This was once the last resting place of one of the great kings of this castle.  The whole room slopes down to the southeast and the lower section is flooded with dark water.  A thick fog covers the floor here obscuring the floor from view.  A throne, probably taken from somewhere else in the castle has been set upon a crudely carved stone dais.  A sick stench permeates this room.
